definition: to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Mancini had effectively lost his midfield.
sentences.chinese: 曼奇尼实际上输掉了中场。

sentences.english: The game is a draw if both teams lose at once.
sentences.chinese: 若两个队伍同时输掉，则该盘游戏为和局。

sentences.english: That "if" is big enough to imply this is a battle lost.
sentences.chinese: 那个“如果”大得足以暗指这一次输掉的战役了。

sentences.english: I was a point from losing this match, and now I managed to come back.
sentences.chinese: 就差一分输掉比赛，现在我设法将比分扳了回来。

sentences.english: My brother would have lost the argument if Dad hadn't interceded for him.
sentences.chinese: 如果当时父亲不替哥哥求情，他就会输掉这场争论。

sentences.english: If you can't, you lose the game.
sentences.chinese: 若你无法如此做，则你输掉这盘游戏。

sentences.english: They have now endured seven defeats in all competitions and there are a lot of stiff challenges still.
sentences.chinese: 他们在各项赛事中已输掉七场，而硬仗还数不胜数。

sentences.english: they're setting up in advance to lose.
sentences.chinese: 他们在输掉之前为自己找好借口。

sentences.english: I realised that I'd let Holland and my team-mates down.
sentences.chinese: 我意识到，我让荷兰队和我的队友输掉了比赛。

sentences.english: He got through the preliminaries but lost out in the finals.
sentences.chinese: 他通过了预赛，但在决赛中输掉了。

sentences.english: The young adult losted his everything.
sentences.chinese: 那个年轻人把什么都输掉了。

sentences.english: The young man has gambled everything away.
sentences.chinese: 那个年轻人把什么都输掉了。

sentences.english: When Nefarious Lich leaves play, you lose the game.
sentences.chinese: 当极恶巫妖离场时，你输掉此盘游戏。

sentences.english: And whoever said T-Mac have no clue. Without TMac we lose this game.
sentences.chinese: 无论谁说麦迪没主意，可是没有麦迪我们会输掉比赛。

sentences.english: Bad luck with Chinese National Football Team, they lost their first round.
sentences.chinese: 国足这次运气不好，第一轮就输掉了比赛。

sentences.english: Only five months ago, Mr Hsieh lost a race for the mayorship of Taipei.
sentences.chinese: 就在五个月前，谢长廷输掉了台北市长选举。

definition: to lose to (sb)/to be outdone by
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
